title: Static libraries fail to build with x86_64-pc-windows-gnu with choco mingw installed (with cause of bug)
body:
We are building a static library on x86_64-pc-windows-gnu on a system that has a choco installed mingw using cargo 1.49.0 (d00d64df9 2020-12-05). I expected to see this happen: We expect it to build Instead, this happened: we get a missing library libgcc_eh. We have seen other examples of this issue through web search, but here is the actual output from gcc: ``` "x86_64-w64-mingw32-gcc" "-fno-use-linker-plugin" "-Wl,--nxcompat" "-m64" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib" "-nodefaultlibs" "-L" "C:\\cygwin\\home\\Administrator\\mongosql-rs\\target\\debug\\deps" "-L" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\libgimli-dfab679e0565d217.rlib" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\libcfg_if-06d418ce9254f841.rlib" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\liblibc-7c3291a8d67347b3.rlib" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\liballoc-9f2b7229edc9025e.rlib" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\librustc_std_workspace_core-4ae0cac901a4e3c1.rlib" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\libcore-9e39cfd0b85a4b6e.rlib" "-Wl,--end-group" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\libcompiler_builtins-de70f57e5c136950.rlib" "-Wl,-Bdynamic" "-ladvapi32" "-lws2_32" "-luserenv" "-lgcc_eh" "-l:libpthread.a" "-lmsvcrt" "-lmingwex" "-lmingw32" "-lgcc" "-lmsvcrt" "-luser32" "-lkernel32" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rsend.o" = note: c:/programdata/chocolatey/lib/mingw/tools/install/mingw64/bin/../lib/gcc/x86_64-w64-mingw32/10.2.0/../../../../x86_64-w64-mingw32/bin/ld.exe: cannot find -lgcc_eh ``` The actual problem here is that only `-L" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib"` is specified, when libgcc_eh is actually in `-L" "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\.rustup\\toolchains\\stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\rustlib\\x86_64-pc-windows-gnu\\lib\\self-contained"` Setting the LD_LIBRARY_PATH to contain self-contained fixes this: `export LIBRARY_PATH=$(cygpath -w /cygdrive/c/Users/Administrator/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/lib/self-contained/)` (on cygwin) The problem is it is picking up the libraries for the newer installed mingw, which no longer has libgcc_eh ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.49.0 (e1884a8e3 2020-12-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: e1884a8e3c3e813aada8254edfa120e85bf5ffca commit-date: 2020-12-29 host: x86_64-pc-windows-gnu release: 1.49.0 ```
Backtrace

``` ```
